channel.title: yudel tweets
channel.description: A feed of recent tweets from yudel.

item.description:
@TfTHacker Two others I would add: PCOutline, which stood outlining from @davewiner and memory residence (remember that?!) from Sidekick. I lived in that for several years.
@TfTHacker @davewiner Now, I use the primitive @NotionHQ outline features as part of relying on Notion to keep track of my myriad tasks and sub tasks. It’s not perfect, but the Kanban view is indispensable.

@froomkin One of the Times’ financial responsibilities is to ensure that Republican in the owners social circle, Republican advertisers, and Republican subscribers don’t turn against the paper because it makes them feel bad. That is what drives the political coverage.
@studentactivism @swordsjew Rounding shows you’re not serious. Make it $42,420.69. Remind Americans that every penny counts.
@YehudahMirsky Regards from the person who called R Eliezer Berkovits from Washington Heights to get the psak for the first US Orthodox minyan in which women led Kabbalah Shabbat.
@bruces I often wonder this about the dinosaurs. How much can we say for sure that there were no dinosaurs who had writing systems?
Strange New Worlds, as (would have been) seen on TV (via VCR). https://t.co/jWlj1ZbMo4
Crime family crimed. https://t.co/OECnquFuJB
Wondering whether the fine folks at @OrthodoxUnion plan to protest this ban against some important halachicly acceptable forms of birth control. https://t.co/33g8jORGnk
@onthemainline Blockchain, but for philosophical transactions.
@NathanJRobinson Give the police suitcase nukes.
@Foone There ought to be an app for that. Or at least a Premiere plug-in.
@onthemainline @moshe_kolat We are considering publishing a volume of Jewish takes on childrens stories. This could be a great premise for such a take.
@Bobblespeak @tompeyer Related: Proposals to bar NJ cops from consuming now-legal weed off duty.
@TheRaDR Also worth noting that Orthodox Jewish law generally finds IUDs and even Plan B more acceptable than condoms.

@DrMarinaArcher @waltshaub Seems like there ought to be provisions for, “if you feel you must break the law and destroy records, please don’t hurt the plumbing by flushing them and please have a fire extinguisher if you’re going to burn them.”
@waltshaub Seems like it would need a cross-agency consult with the EPA, but having never worked in the government, what do I know?
Hard to believe we’ve been on Twitter for years without spotting a Yehezkel Kaufman reference but glad to say that drought is over. https://t.co/HebvHK09jN

This may well be deeply concerning. But…. https://t.co/YjDYJyogqX
One distressing fact in the present moment is that American governance is deeply broken by the Republican prioritization of waging war against the Democrats above everything else.
The Atlantic recently reported that when Syria crossed Obama’s red line and used poison gas, Obama decided that waging was was a job for Congress and he approached McConnell — who declined to act.
After all, why hand Obama a foreign policy win?
As we’ve seen with the slow walking of approving key foreign policy posts, the Republicans are doing the minimum to support US foreign policy.
(Note that they allowed a Republican to hold up Iron Dome aid, figuring that Israel supporters wouldn’t hold the party accountable, and they were right. As @rmneiss has documented, AIPAC spent ten times more attacking the Democrats who initially opposed the aid than
the Republican who continued to object for several more months.)
From the perspective of Joe Biden, foreign policy as usual saves him from Republican criticism. And they, for better or worse, seems to be a major goal of his.
If the Iran deal falls apart, that will be why. Unlike Obama, who was an idealist, Biden will be making a political decision. I think Obama was legit scared by Bibi into seeking the deal — much to Bibi’s chagrin, of course.
Faced with the mental image of nuked Israelis, Obama was willing to spend political capital to slow Iran’s drive to the bomb. Biden is not.
Frankly, I can’t say I blame him.
@allshiny Hmmm. A possible recommendation for us guilty carnivores. (Or non-practicing vegetarians, as we prefer to call ourselves.) if I may ask: How old were you when you stopped eating meat?
@sirosenbaum See, they give away for free, and even professionals wonder why they can’t make $1/word like in olden times.
@ShulimLeifer Whereas his school would no doubt suggest Tehillim. Which I believe were tried during last century’s great German unpleasantness. How did that work out again?

@AD_Lobel I would not travel with that man, who clearly does not know how to hire qualified people. Though really, preferring to communicate by snailmail is a red flag, as I tell people who don’t want to submit doc or pdf files.

@evawyner @kampeas Lot of people loved President Obama, but so few renamed their school after him…. :-)
@evawyner @kampeas I went to Cleveland’s Agnon School, which was also renamed, so I share in the alumni outrage over the renaming.
@johnastoehr Can’t believe I missed this piece about him in November. https://t.co/bcT6VZflbj
